intro: Tornabenea insularis, commonly known as the island tansy, is a flowering plant native to specific island regions in the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in coastal and saline environments, showing adaptations to withstand salt spray and sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and attract various pollinators. Tornabenea insularis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
